sen.j: 大江山いく野の道の遠ければ まだ「ふみ」もみず天の「橋立」
sen.e: Oeyama ikunonomichi no tookereba mada 'fumi'momizu ama no 'hashidate' (Mt. Oe and the road that goes to Ikuno are far away; so I have neither seen the letter from, nor 'stepped on,' Amano'hashi'date which is the 'ladder' to heaven) by Koshikibu no Naishi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the waka by Koshikibu no Naishi: Oeyama ikunonomichi no tookereba mada "fumi" momizu ama no "hashidate" (Mt. Oe and the road that goes to Ikuno are far away, so I have neither seen a "letter" from, nor "travelled by foot" there from Amano"hashidate." In this poem, "fumi" means both a "letter" and to "travel by foot," and although Amano-Hashidate is a place, the "hashidate" is also a reference to the "ladder" to heaven).
sen.cmt: An explanation is lacking in translation one, so I did what I could to make sense of it.
sen.e: Oeyama ikunonomichi no tookereba mada "fumi" mo mizu ama no "hashidate" (Mt. Oe and the road that goes to Ikuno are far away, so I have neither seen a "letter" from, nor "travelled by foot" there to Amano "hashidate" [In this poem, "fumi" means both a "letter" and to "travel by foot," and although Amano-Hashidate is a place, the "hashidate" is also a reference to the "ladder" to heaven])
sen.cmt: 天橋立へ行ったこともない、という意味ですので、to Amanohashidate としました。
